intro: Pholidota assamica, commonly known as the Assam boxwood, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
